content: I cannot invite members to a stream anymore with "Invite more users" or settings->"Invite users". Has anyone else experienced that problem or have knowledge of any changes made to the organization settings to disallow it?

If someone is a user, subscribing them to a stream works:
image.png

But "invite more users" doesn't seem to work (in Chrome).

That is also what I see (Doesn't work in Edge either). I have tried to write to support, but they also just state that I can add existing users.

I can see from the documentation, that the organization admin can disable the invite feature. Does anyone know who is organization admin and if any adjustments has been made recently?
@Tim Abbott is the one most likely to know what's going on here.

I think the problem is that the administrators have created a stream that is a "default stream" - all new members are added that is also private; a bug in the handling this corner case means that the invitation widget is broken.
The fix on your end is almost certainly to make the default, private stream no longer a default stream.
An organization administrator can do this here: https://chat.fhir.org/#organization/default-streams-list
I just get a blank page for that
@Tim Abbott - that is both in the desktop client and in Chrome directly
I guess the offending "default stream" is one you're not on, either. Let me see.
OK, I've fixed the data problem -- the issue was that the problematic "default streams" were deactivated.
So there should be nothing you need to do.
And opened https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/14745 to track fixing the root issue here.
(There's an existing, separate issue, for the fact that this weird situation caused the "invite more users" and "default streams" UIs to not load properly)
